CatDescriptText: Mr. Alfred B. House, bank employee, 1926 Shaler Dr., Glenshaw, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 24, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that President Eisenhower should invoke the Taft-Hartley Act in steel strike?" answer reads: "I have the feeling that the invocation of the Taft-Hartley law will not do much good. My feeling is that management and labor will take the 80 days, and after that they will walk out again."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Alfred B. House wearing dark fine herringbone jacket, eyeglasses, and diagonally striped tie with tie bar, posed in front of Mellon Bank, Downtown
